intro: Achyronychia rixfordii, commonly known as the Rixford's glorybower, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to red. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
